title: The Norman chroniclers offered several lurid versions of the murder ofEdmund Ironside. William of Malmesbury had heard he was murdered by a 'sharp basulard' as he sat down to relieve himself. Another version has him being hit by an arrow driven by a secret mechanism within a wooden statue. Gaimar combines both versions by having the unfortunate king shot
